.left-code[

# Make a Scatterplot

```{r plot-label, eval=FALSE}
# Make a scatterplot
ggplot(iris) + 
  aes(x=Sepal.Length, 
      y=Sepal.Width, 
      color = Species) + 
  geom_point() +
  xlab("Sepal Length") +
  ylab("Sepal Width") +
  ggtitle("IRIS Dataset")
  
```
]

.right-plot[
```{r plot-label-out, ref.label="plot-label", echo=FALSE, fig.dim=c(4.8, 4.5), out.width="100%"}
```
]

---

.left-code[

# Scatterplot - step-by-step

```{r plot-label1, eval=FALSE}
# Step 1 specify dataset iris for ggplot()
ggplot(iris) #<<
```

The basic plot space is created.

]

.right-plot[
```{r plot-label1-out, ref.label="plot-label1", echo=FALSE, fig.dim=c(4.8, 4.5), out.width="100%"}
```
]

---

.left-code[

# Scatterplot - step-by-step

```{r plot-label2, eval=FALSE}
# Next add aes (aesthetics)
ggplot(iris) + 
  aes(x=Sepal.Length, #<<
      y=Sepal.Width)  #<<
```

Add "aesthetics" using aes - provide the variables for X and Y axes. Notice the `aes()` is added using the `+` operator.

]

.right-plot[
```{r plot-label2-out, ref.label="plot-label2", echo=FALSE, fig.dim=c(4.8, 4.5), out.width="100%"}
```
]

---

.left-code[

# Add a geom - geometric object

```{r plot-label3, eval=FALSE}
# Add points to graph
ggplot(iris) + 
  aes(x=Sepal.Length, 
      y=Sepal.Width) + 
  geom_point() #<<
  
```

Add `geom_point()` to add the points to the graph.

]

.right-plot[
```{r plot-label3-out, ref.label="plot-label3", echo=FALSE, fig.dim=c(4.8, 4.5), out.width="100%"}
```
]

---

.left-code[

# Add color aes

```{r plot-label4, eval=FALSE}
# Add color aesthetic
ggplot(iris) + 
  aes(x=Sepal.Length, 
      y=Sepal.Width,
      color = Species) + #<<
  geom_point() 
  
```

Add `color` option to the aesthetics inside the `aes()`.

]

.right-plot[
```{r plot-label4-out, ref.label="plot-label4", echo=FALSE, fig.dim=c(4.8, 4.5), out.width="100%"}
```
]

.left-code[

```{r plot-label5, eval=FALSE}

  aes(x=Sepal.Length, 
      y=Sepal.Width,
      color = Species) + 
  geom_point() +
  xlab("Sepal Length") +   #<<
```

.left-code[

# Make a histogram with overlaid density curve

```{r histplot, eval=FALSE}
# Use iris dataset
# Petal.Width variable
# Histogram with density curve
# Use y=..density..
# Overlay with transparent density plot
ggplot(iris, aes(x=Petal.Width)) + 
  geom_histogram(aes(y=..density..),      
                 binwidth=.5,
                 colour="black", 
                 fill="white") +
  geom_density(alpha=.2, 
               fill="#FF6666") +
  xlim(-1, 4) #<<
```

`xlim()` added to expand default limits

]

.right-plot[

```{r histplot-out, ref.label="histplot", echo=FALSE, fig.dim=c(4.8, 4.5), out.width="100%"}
```

]

# Pulling it together - make a canvas

# Patchwork!

```{r out.width = '20%', echo=FALSE}
knitr::include_graphics("img/patchworklogo.png")
```

---

```{r plot-patch, eval=FALSE}
library(ggplot2)
library(patchwork)

# save each plot as an object
p1 <- ggplot(mtcars) + geom_point(aes(mpg, disp))
p2 <- ggplot(mtcars) + geom_boxplot(aes(gear, disp, group = gear))
p3 <- ggplot(mtcars) + geom_smooth(aes(disp, qsec))
p4 <- ggplot(mtcars) + geom_bar(aes(carb))

# arrange plots as you like
(p1 | p2 | p3) / p4
```

```{r plot-patch-out, ref.label="plot-patch", echo=FALSE, fig.dim=c(10, 5)}
```
